meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or situated at the base.
meanings.sent1: The basilar part of the mountain was the widest and most stable.
meanings.sent2: The basilar support held up the entire structure.
meanings.sent3: The basilar foundation was so strong, it seemed like it could hold up the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as basilar as the roots of a tree, grounding her in every storm.
meanings.sent5: The basilar connection between them was unbreakable, like the unyielding earth beneath their feet.

meanings.sent1: The basilar layer provided a solid starting point for the project.
meanings.sent2: The basilar structure was essential for the stability of the building.
meanings.sent3: His basilar argument was so strong, it formed the cornerstone of the debate.
meanings.sent4: The friendship they shared was the basilar support for their happiness.
meanings.sent5: The basilar principle of honesty formed the foundation of their relationship.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the base of the skull.
meanings.sent1: The basilar bone at the back of the skull provided protection.
meanings.sent2: The basilar region of the skull was crucial for support and movement.
meanings.sent3: The basilar area of the skull seemed like a hidden treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in his mind, a basilar joy that kept him going.
meanings.sent5: The basilar structure of the skull ensured the safety of the brain within.
